title: Dustin Poirier claims he is fighting Conor McGregor after failed UFC title challenge

Dustin Poirier has claimed his next fight will be against Conor McGregor .

The pair fought in 2014 with McGregor winning by first-round stoppage before going on to win first the featherweight and then the lightweight titles.

Poirier, meanwhile, eventually earned a 155lb title shot against Khabib Nurmagomedov last month but was submitted in the third round.

McGregor is also coming off a defeat by the unbeaten Russian and is expected to return to the UFC early next year.

He and Poirier have engaged in verbal sparring in recent weeks and the latter has now hinted a deal may be close.

(Image: Zuffa LLC via Getty Images)

He was called out by Dan Hooker following his points win over Al Iaquinta in Melbourne on Saturday.

Hooker said: "Dustin Poirier, I'm going to smash your face in... I'm going to end you."

But Poirier immediately took to Twitter to respond: "I'm fighting the Irishman next. You're close but not yet buddy keep punching."

It remains to be seen whether a deal will be agreed, but McGregor is expected to fight either Poirier or Justin Gaethje as he seeks his first victory in the Octagon for three years.

(Image: Zuffa LLC via Getty Images)

Last week, McGregor and Poirier continued to trade insults on Twitter.

After the Dubliner had taunted Jorge Masvidal and Nate Diaz about their forthcoming fight, Poirier highlighted the last time McGregor won in the Octagon - his lightweight title win over Eddie Alvarez in November 2016.

Poirier tweeted: "Three years 10 days since you won your last fight. Do the math champ."

But McGregor hit back with: "Awesome bro. Now count my bank digits."
description: Poirier lost to McGregor in 2014 but wants a rematch following his loss to Khabib Nurmagomedov last month
